content.name: p
children: Starter projects provide a starting point when bootstrapping new projects, for example, when using interactive tools like
. Users can select a base project from the list of starters in the devfile.

content.name: p
children: , and a definition for either a
object to set the location for the starter source code.

content.name: Fence
children:
----
schemaVersion: 2.1.0
starterProjects:
- name: nodejs-starter
  git:
    remotes:
      origin: https://github.com/odo-devfiles/nodejs-ex.git
  
- name: nodejs-zip-starter
  zip:
    location: https://github.com/odo-devfiles/nodejs-ex/archive/refs/tags/0.0.2.zip
----

content.name: p
children: For a Git source in a starter project, a single remote must be specified. You can checkout from a specific branch name, tag or commit id. The default branch is used if the revision is not specified, or if the specified revision is not found.

content.name: p
children: field, you can specify a sub-directory in the project to be used as root for the starter project.

content.name: Fence

attributes.title: A starter project specifying revision and subDir

children:
----
schemaVersion: 2.2.0
starterProjects:
- name: demo-starter
  git:
    remotes:
      origin: <git-repo>
      checkoutFrom:
        revision: 1.1.0Final
    
    subDir: demo
----
